content.label: There is no better game than this!!!!!
6/5 I cant believe I’ve waited so long to play this. So many dead guildmates

Great game, love the lack of in app purchases. 

Very fun to play. 

Needs a new expansion very badly. PLEASE give us new content.
This isn’t mastered for the iPhone. The words are freakin tiny. Not fun.

title.label: Fun to learn, glitchy to play

content.label: I’ve played for a little bit now and continually run across a 1009 Battlecard/ check texture validity () error. You’d think that for a game that is a little pricey for the App Store it would be error free. Especially a game that’s been around for a little while. Where’s the patches and updates?
Please!

It’s easy to play right away, and it’s easy to die no matter what dungeoneer you use.  So you have to get enough money to upgrade the decks and unlock characters that you will need, along with luck, to pass harder levels. You don’t actually train your characters (for very long) you really just learn which characters work better, and which upgrades work better.

It’s a lot of fun if you don’t mind dying most of the time, and gaining in game knowledge rather than experience or level of your dungeoneers, which always die. One of my most promising characters died in the first encounter with a bat with 3 hp.  What can you say, they just regenerate as beginners again, all hero’s are completely disposable.  Otherwise pretty cool.

I give it an extra star for not being dependent on in-app purchases. It’s an interesting game, and pretty fun if you’re not too easily annoyed by constantly dying by a passive RNG
Finally something without ads and add ons that can be played just as is. Great game for kicking back for a few minutes and killing time between projects
Good memes

This is a fun game that is easy to pick up and put down.  Because it’s turn based there is no stress to monitor it constantly.  Perfect for when there’s a few minute to fill. Careful though! It can be addicting!

One note, it’s starting to menu a little slow, may need an update for the newer OS

I can't put this down. Love the card battles, and the thrill of figuring out how best to use each character.

If I could change one thing: I'd like to be able to write my own epitaphs.  My dungeoneers deserve better than simply "he didn't get out much"

A very fun, pay once and play card battler. I like being able to play this kind of game at my own pace without multiplayer. Grind feels just about right - always giving you new stuff to see, new loot to use and progressively better character classes to master. Way, way worth the price of admission...I’ve gotten a good 30 hours out of it easily, and still enjoying.

This game is beautifully made but the gameplay is poor due to its random elements. Characters will die against weaker opponents just because you drew the wrong cards. The game’s suggestion to “keep your deck lean” is infuriating, not helpful. 
There is very little sense of accomplishment, since you always seem to be starting over.

Even though this app is compatible with my device, a lot of the text is way too small to read with no ability to change the font size. A heads up that this app is intended for larger screens would have saved me $7. 

Buy accordingly.
I love the concept. I love that it's a full game and no BS DLC or IAP. Keep up the good work.
Is fun
Disappointed great reviews seems fun but I play for a few rounds and get a battlecard texture error that locks the game up, very odd wish I could attach screenshot.
If you take a new Dungeoneer in to the second level of a dungeon they have almost no chance.

title.label: If it's your kind of game, it's amazing

content.label: It's not for everyone but it fills its niche very well.

Matches are rarely fair and typically my characters die on the FIRST fight before I can even get equipment.  Would be a great game if you weren’t grinding less than ten coins per dungeon to unlock equipment you won’t even get a chance to use.

What a wonderful experience! I’ve put maybe 8 hours on and off and I can’t seem to not want to play it. Truthfully I’m still at the 2nd part of the game and have gone through 4-5 Dungeoneers but heck just the journey and the joy of learning this game is great. If your looking for a card/board game. This is by far one of the best. The only I would really hope for would be some sort of multiplayer. I could for sure see it doable, by coop or vs. Either way great job devs. Seems you all sport beards and drink the finest of brews! Ciao

The game is great fun, I love it on PC and iPad, however on iPad the cards are super low resolution at some points (specifically when choosing loot) and it completely ruins an otherwise clean and sleek appearance. It may be minor but it drives me nuts.

Love the graphics, the funny quips on each card, the bard telling stories, the battle mechanics, the card-based dungeon building, and I could go on and on with all the little details..

Great job, developers

I could see the appeal to this on an iphone plus or the pc version, but on iphone x the text size and inability to zoom makes it a repulsive experience, u have to hold the phone 3 inchs from your face

What a fun game!  It’s hard to find a game with so much replay value that doesn’t have a big paywall. The $6 was totally worth it. I’d give five stars if it didn’t crash every time I get a text message or switch apps.

After many games I think I've got my head around the idea that the dungeoneers are expendable and I understand the mechanics.  My problems with the game are two-fold.  

First, there are SO MANY texture error messages that lock the game.  Nothing like dropping 30 minutes of gameplay because of a crash.  Four times tonight alone.  The iPad is a known quantity so there is no excuse for resource look-up errors.

Next, the math is weird sometimes.  I will occasionally die even as a boosted character against level 2 monsters.  I have yet to beal L2 of the second dungeon (loot 3 chests) because of weird endings.  

Good game at $7 with a different mechanic.  Very glad I didn't spend more on PC or Mac version.  Just not sure it is one I'll remember I own in a month.

There’s a great deal to like about this game. It’s fun, it’s novel, and it’s not too easy or generally too hard either.

When it’s fair that is - given some of the requirements for some dungeons (reach the eye beast in 9 turns or get petrified) are only randomly achievable - depending on whether or not you’ll actually get cards to reach the boss in time.

That’s not fun - that’s frustratingly silly. So are the bard’s voiceovers the designers seem to have fallen in love with (at least you can turn those off), and the choice to play the game at 3x, which means battles go faster but you have to miss all the dialogue that actually is decent.

So yeah - I still play, and I’d buy a v2.0 with some extra polish in a heartbeat. But I’m also regularly putting it down because the fun gets interrupted with annoyance just a little too often.

I want to like this game, it’s unique, but it crashes after 10 min or so (memory leak?). I emailed the developer (no clear support offering) but no word. 1 Star until it can be resolved or ill have to ask for my money back. I’m not paying for an app that locks and crashes every time I use it. This should have been tested.
Enjoying the game, however I keep getting a 1009 error that then causes the game to crash at the next battle. Sad day.

title.label: Dungeon Crawling with a Comic Twist

content.label: Fun game of hero developement, dungeon creation and cruel comedy. Love the simple graphics, music and great replay ability.
Half the dungeons have Texture errors, so you get to try and fight with a blank screen.
There’s no actual story
The music alone is worth buying this game! I've gotten a ton of laughs throughout my time of playing this game. Thanks to Extra Credits for recommending this game!
부담없는 던전 크롤. 모바일 환경에 딱 맞는 조작감.
G8
Comes with the dlc all for 6 bucks. Perfect
Makes me reminisce about all the D&D maps I made as a kid.

Such funny. Much Rogue. 

“Do you want some kind of coffee, Mr. Key Master (of Gozer)?” 

Do I?

“Yes, have some.”

Yes, have some...
It's fun that the different classes excel at different dungeons.

What a fun game. 
All the way through. 
Here's hoping the "Pirate Ship" finds a whole new world to lead us "dungeonmasters" to more fun, challenging and kinda whacky adventures.
I'd have paid double for this fun and silly game:-)
I really like this game. The narration and situations are comical and although you'd think I'd get gruelingly tiring- it's till fun and original
Plenty of hours to play.
Wish it had an infinite, rogue-like dungeon so I could play this game forever.
Great pick up and put down dog!

Without the crashes this is a 5-star game but it's almost guaranteed to black screen when I start it, or else crash with a texture error during play. It's too bad becuase this is one of the few enjoyable iOS games.

I usually cringe at games that have one or two symbols on a card.  The gameplay on Guild of Dungeoneering is AWESOME - take it from someone who bought his D&D Basic Set in 8th grade.  Somehow the game makes a large set of simple cards feel like intricate combat.  Confused? Hold your finger over a card for a description.

If you've played M:TG you will know the drill - outdraw, discard, overpower or counter - but this game is its own milieu.

I hope there is an option to replay the bard for discovered stuff!
A fresh take on dungeon exploration.
Its great 15 min sesh maybe make it 10 in fast its good tho!

I tend to avoid paying games on my phone, but I enjoy RPGs. The silliness factor keeps me engaged. The characters are cute, and once you get the hang of it, your dungeoneers start kicking some serious butt. I'm worried about it becoming too repetitive, but so far, I'm enjoying it a lot.

This is one of my favorite mobile games.  It doesn't make you pay to win.  It isn't time based so you can only do so much before you are done.  The game play with cards and different characters is fun as well.
